page.title: 18WEST END FARM
page.content: { { }West End Farm is typical of the two main types of farm in the area.This is a mixed type of farm consisting of arable farming and a dairy herd of thirty four cows all milked by machine. In the summer months Mr.Lovely, the farmer, takes his cattle out to graze in the fields which helps to produce a greater milk yield.During the winter months the cattle are brought into the large farm buildings and fed on silage and cattle cake.The milk is sent by tanker to Northern Dairies at Bramley.Here the milk is packed into cartons and sent to supermarkets. Bullocks born on the farm are sold as beef cattle to other farmers.A new barn,built at the cost of three thousand pounds stores much of his machinery.
